newsitem.title: USA: USDA revs up Brazil 1996 orange juice crop, exports.
newsitem.headline: USDA revs up Brazil 1996 orange juice crop, exports.

text.p: The U.S. Agriculture Department Tuesday said it revised up its estimate for Brazil total orange juice production in 1996 (Brazilian marketing year 1996/97) by 88,000 tonnes to 1.14 million tonnes.

In its monthly World Horticultural Trade and U.S. Export Opportunities report, USDA also revised up its Brazil orange juice export forecast to 1.095 million tonnes from 1.05 million tonnes seen previously, citing higher exports to date than earlier expected.
The revised Brazil estimates by USDA were not a big surprise for the market which has been expecting an increase. Traders are waiting for the Brazilian box count.
USDA said the higher output estimate was based on increased orange production and processing estimates for the Sao Paulo commercial orange area.
It said the U.S. agricultural officer in Sao Paulo increased the 1996 (harvest began mid-1996 and extended through early 1997) orange crop estimate to 369 million boxes from 357 million boxes.
The Sao Paulo oranges for processing estimate for 1996/97 was increased to 269 million boxes from 260 million boxes based on the larger harvest.
"According to industry sources, the crushing season is over for almost all processing plants in Sao Paulo," USDA said.
